sentences: Ta oli juba tööl kui ma tulin.
context: The Estonian word 'tööle' is the illative case of the noun 'töö' (work). It indicates movement toward or to a place of work, meaning 'to work', 'for work', or 'on duty'. In the first sentence, it shows when someone goes to work. The second example demonstrates going to work tomorrow morning. The third sentence uses the elative form 'tööl' which means 'at work' - showing location rather than movement.
